oranges twice. What is the resulting number of oranges?
bonusQ:
MATH Multiple Choice Which of the following statements about squares is NOT true? 
 
W) A square is a rectangle 
X) A square is a parallelogram 
Y) A square is a rhombus 
Z) A square’s diagonals are equal to its side lengths
bonusA: Z) A SQUARE’S DIAGONALS ARE EQUAL TO ITS SIDE LENGTHS

modification”, suggesting that all life on Earth shares a common ancestor that gave rise to the 
fantastic diversity we see today?
bonusQ: LIFE SCIENCE Short Answer What type of muscle is the intestine?

tossupQ:
ENERGY Multiple Choice Gravitational potential energy in an object can be increased or 
decreased by changing which of the following? 
 
W) Speed of its movement 
X) Height that the object is lifted 
Y) Acceleration 
Z) Momentum
tossupA: X) HEIGHT THAT THE OBJECT IS LIFTED

ENERGY Short Answer The energy from heat can be transferred in any of three ways. 
Name these three ways.

GENERAL SCIENCE Short Answer Contrary to popular belief, there were several inventors 
who contributed to the development of the light bulb. Name two.
tossupA:
(ACCEPT TWO) DAVY, DE LA RUE, EDISON, SWAN, LATIMER, BRUSH, 
WHITNEY, COOLIDGE, LINDSAY, SHEPARD, EVANS, STARR, DeMOLEYNS
bonusQ:

electric light, inventing an electric lighting system that contained all the elements necessary to 
make incandescent light practical, safe, and economical. Which of the following was NOT 
included in his inventions? 
 
W) Parallel circuit 
X) Safety fuse 
Y) Light socket with on and off switches 
Z) Electric generator

bonusQ:
EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Chemically, what is the difference 
between limestone and dolomite? 
 
W) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing only calcium, while dolomite contains both calcium 
and magnesium 
X) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing only magnesium, while dolomite contains only 
calcium 
Y) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing both calcium and magnesium, while dolomite 
contains only calcium 
Z) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing only calcium, while dolomite contains only 
magnesium
bonusA:
W) LIMESTONE IS A CARBONATE ROCK CONTAINING ONLY CALCIUM, WHILE 
DOLOMITE CONTAINS BOTH CALCIUM AND MAGNESIUM

W) Whale songs travelling through Arctic water compared to whale songs travelling through

EXCITED DOG BARKS
